Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; An identifier for the service user. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob ObjID attribute and the PRJobID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

List of event identifiers that cause the equipment to automatically transition to the Pausing/Paused states when one of the listed events is triggered. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob PauseEvent attribute and the PauseEvent DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PauseEvent parameter reports the GEM300 event identifiers (CEIDs) and EDAPauseEvent reports the EDA source and event identifiers that will pause the ProcessJob

Attributes.Description: A unique sub-state of the job according to the ProcessJob state model. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob PRJobState attribute and the PRJobState DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PRJobState provides the current ProcessJob state enumerated value and ProcessJobCurrState provides the ProcessJob state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where PRJobState reports the ProcessJob state prior to destruction and ProcessJobCurrState reports NoState

Attributes.Description: List of identifiers of the material being processed. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob PRMtlNameList attribute and the PRMtlNameList DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PRMtlType parameter defines the type of material and form of the PRMtlNameList parameter value

Attributes.Description: Identifies the type of material being processed. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob PRMtlType attribute and the PRMtlType DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PRMtlType parameter defines the type of material and form of the PRMtlNameList parameter value

Attributes.Description: Indicates if the processing resource starts processing immediately when ready (true) or must be started manually (false). This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob PRProcessStart attribute and the PRProcessStart DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

Indication of recipe specification type, whether using is applied and which method is used. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob PRRecipeMethod attribute and the PRRecipeMethod DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PRRecipeMethod defines if the recipe variables defined in RecVariableList will be used when executing the ProcessJob

Attributes.Description: 255 characters maximum; Identifier of the recipe applied. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob RecID attribute - the RecID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
List of variables supporting a recipe method. This parameter merges the E40 ProcessJob RecipeVariableList attribute and the RecVariableList DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PRRecipeMethod defines if the recipe variables defined in RecVariableList will be used when executing the ProcessJob

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the ProcessJob state machine. This value matches the PRJobState with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PRJobState provides the current ProcessJob state enumerated value and ProcessJobCurrState provides the ProcessJob state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where PRJobState reports the ProcessJob state prior to destruction and ProcessJobCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the ProcessJob state machine

List of EDA event identifiers that cause the equipment to automatically transition to the Pausing/Paused states when one of the listed events is triggered. This parameter corresponds with the PauseEvent attribute except it provides the EDA names and sources for the events

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PauseEvent parameter reports the GEM300 event identifiers (CEIDs) and EDAPauseEvent reports the EDA source and event identifiers that will pause the ProcessJob

SimpleEvent.Description: The processing resource reports that material processing has commenced
Processing resource reports that all required pre-conditioning has completed and that it cannot proceed until the process job material arrives
Processing resource reports that it has changed state

Attributes.Description: Maximum number of substrates a carrier can hold. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier Capacity attribute and the Capacity DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Current state of the Carrier ID verification. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier CarrierIDStatus attribute and the CarrierIDStatus DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The CarrierIDStatus provides the current carrier identifier status enumerated value and CarrierIDStatusCurrState provides the Carrier Identifier Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where CarrierIDStatus reports the carrier identifier status prior to destruction and CarrierIDStatusCurrState reports NoState

Attributes.Description: Current accessing state of the carrier by the equipment. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier CarrierAccessingStatus attribute and the CarrierAccessingStatus DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The CarrierAccessingStatus provides the current carrier accessing status enumerated value and CarrierAccessingStatusCurrState provides the Carrier Accessing Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where CarrierAccessingStatus reports the carrier accessing status prior to destruction and CarrierAccessingStatusCurrState reports NoState

Attributes.Description: Ordered list of lot and substrate identifiers corresponding to slot 1,2,3,...n. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier ContentMap attribute and the ContentMap DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
80 characters maximum; Identifier of the current location. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier LocationID attribute and the LocationID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
80 characters maximum; Object identifier of the Carrier object. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier ObjID attribute and the CarrierID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Ordered list of slot status corresponding to slot 1,2,3,...n. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier SlotMap attribute and the SlotMap DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Current state of slot map verification. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier SlotMapStatus attribute and the SlotMapStatus DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SlotMapStatus provides the current slot map status enumerated value and CarrierSlotMapStatusCurrState provides the Slot Map Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SlotMapStatus reports the carrier identifier status prior to destruction and CarrierSlotMapStatusCurrState reports NoState

Attributes.Description: Number of substrates currently in the carrier. This parameter merges the E87 Carrier SubstrateCount attribute and the SubstrateCount DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
80 characters maximum; Type of material contained in the carrier. This parameter represents the E87 Carrier Usage attribute.

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the CarrierAccessingStatus state machine. This value matches the CarrierAccessingStatus with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The CarrierAccessingStatus provides the current carrier accessing status enumerated value and CarrierAccessingStatusCurrState provides the Carrier Accessing Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where CarrierAccessingStatus reports the carrier accessing status prior to destruction and CarrierAccessingStatusCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the CarrierAccessingStatus state machine
128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the CarrierIDStatus state machine. This value matches the CarrierIDStatus with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The CarrierIDStatus provides the current carrier identifier status enumerated value and CarrierIDStatusCurrState provides the Carrier Identifier Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where CarrierIDStatus reports the carrier identifier status prior to destruction and CarrierIDStatusCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the CarrierIDStatus state machine
128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the CarrierSlotMapStatus state machine. This value matches the SlotMapStatus with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SlotMapStatus provides the current slot map status enumerated value and CarrierSlotMapStatusCurrState provides the Slot Map Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SlotMapStatus reports the carrier identifier status prior to destruction and CarrierSlotMapStatusCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the CarrierSlotMapStatus state machine
Identifier of the load port where the carrier is located. This parameter represents the E87 PortID DV.
The reason for transition 14, SlotMapNotRead to WaitingForHost. This parameter represents the E87 Reason DV.

SimpleEvent.Description: Carrier has changed locations within the equipment
Occurs when the equipment determines access to the carrier is nearing completion

Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; Contains the ID read from the substrate (Empty string before the substrate is read). This parameter merges the E90 Substrate AcquiredID attribute and the AcquiredID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The ObjID provides the identifier for a substrate object instance and the AcquiredID provides the id read directly from the substrate after the tool performs the read

Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; Identifier for current batch location. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate BatchLocID attribute and the SubstBatchLocID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

80 characters maximum; Identifier of the lot associated with the substrate by the user. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate LotID attribute and the SubstLotID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

Current status of the substrate that represents criteria of the processing quality. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate MaterialStatus attribute and the SubstMtrlStatus DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
80 characters maximum; Object identifier of the Substrate object. This parameter corresponds to the E90 Substrate ObjID attribute

AssociatedParameter.Description: The ObjID provides the identifier for a substrate object instance and the SubstID provides the identifier for a substrate when an event occurs that reports state change for a single substrate
The ObjID provides the identifier for a substrate object instance and the AcquiredID provides the id read directly from the substrate after the tool performs the read

Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; Identifier of the substrate location on which the substrate shall be finally restored. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstDestination attribute and the SubstDestination DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
History of locations visited. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstHistory attribute and the SubstHistory DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Status of the substrate ID read. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstIDStatus attribute and the SubstIDStatus DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstIDStatus provides the current substrate identifier status enumerated value and SubstrateReadingStatusCurrState provides the Substrate Identifier Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SubstIDStatus reports the substrate transport state prior to destruction and SubstrateReadingStatusCurrState reports NoState

Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; Identifier for current equipment substrate location or carrier substrate location that the substrate occupies. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstLocID attribute and the SubstSubstLocID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
80 characters maximum; Current substrate position in a batch. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstPosInBatch attribute and the SubstPosInBatch DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Processing state of the substrate. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstProcState attribute and the SubstProcState DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)s

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstProcState provides the current processing state enumerated value and SubstrateProcessingCurrState provides the Substrate Processing state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SubstProcState reports the substrate processing state prior to destruction and SubstrateProcessingCurrState reports NoState

Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; Identifier of the substrate location on which the substrate has been initially registered. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstSource attribute and the SubstSource DV is unnecessary because EDA allows attributes in reports
Transport state of the substrate. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstState attribute and the SubstState DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstState provides the current transport state enumerated value and SubstrateTransportCurrState provides the Substrate Transport state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SubstState reports the substrate transport state prior to destruction and SubstrateTransportCurrState reports NoState

Attributes.Description: The type of the substrate. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstType attribute and the SubstType DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
How the substrate is used. This parameter merges the E90 Substrate SubstUsage attribute and the SubstUsage DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the SubstrateProcessing state machine. This value matches the SubstProcState with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstProcState provides the current processing state enumerated value and SubstrateProcessingCurrState provides the Substrate Processing state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SubstProcState reports the substrate processing state prior to destruction and SubstrateProcessingCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the SubstrateProcessing state machine
128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the SubstrateReadingStatus state machine. This value matches the SubstIDStatus with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstIDStatus provides the current substrate identifier status enumerated value and SubstrateReadingStatusCurrState provides the Substrate Identifier Status state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SubstIDStatus reports the substrate transport state prior to destruction and SubstrateReadingStatusCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the SubstrateReadingStatus state machine
128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the SubstrateTransport state machine. This value matches the SubstState with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstState provides the current transport state enumerated value and SubstrateTransportCurrState provides the Substrate Transport state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where SubstState reports the substrate transport state prior to destruction and SubstrateTransportCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the SubstrateTransport state machine
A list of AcquiredIDs related by the same Substrate Object State Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of SubstBatchLocIDs related by the same Substrate Object State Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of SubstDestinations related by the same Substrate object State Model transition that triggered a collection event
A list of SubstHistory's related by the same Substrate Object State Model state transition that triggered a collection event

80 characters maximum; Identifier of substrate associated with the last event. This parameter corresponds to the E90 SubstID DV. This parameter has the same value as ObjID if the event notification is for a single substrate. It will be empty on a group of substrates and SubstIDList will be set instead

AssociatedParameter.Description: The ObjID provides the identifier for a substrate object instance and the SubstID provides the identifier for a substrate when an event occurs that reports state change for a single substrate

EventData.Description: A list of substrate identifiers related by the same Substrate Object State Model state transition that triggered a collection event with which this variable was associated. This parameter will be empty when the event reports a single substrate and SubstID will be set instead
A list of SubstIDStatuses related by the same Substrate Object State Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of substrate location identifiers related by the same Substrate Object State Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of substrate LotIDs related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of MtrlStatus related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of SubstPosInBatchs related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of substrate process states related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event with which this variable was associated
A list of SubstSources related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of substrate states related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event with which this variable was associated
A list of SubstTypes related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event
A list of SubstUsages related by the same Substrate Object Model state transition that triggered a collection event

Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; Object identifier of the SubstLoc object. This parameter merges the E90 SubstLoc ObjID attribute and the SubstLocID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

Indicates if the transitions for this substrate location either generate (false) or do not generate (true) events to the host. This parameter corresponds to the E90 SubstrateLocation DisableEvents attribute

80 characters maximum; Substrate identifier relevant to the location. This parameter merges the E90 SubstrateLocation SubstID attribute and the SubstLocSubstID DV (since EDA identifies instances with the event sourceID)

AssociatedParameter.Description: MaterialID is a generic parameter defined on all material locations and will report the identical value as SubstID on the SubstrateLocation

Attributes.Description: Substrate location state for the location. This parameter merges the E90 SubstrateLocation SubstLocState attribute and the SubstLocState DV (since EDA identifies instances with the event sourceID)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstLocState provides the current substrate location state enumerated value and SubstrateLocationCurrState provides the Substrate Location state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence

EventData.Description: 80 characters maximum; Identifier of the material in the location. This is a generic parameter defined for all material locations and will provide the same value as SubstID

AssociatedParameter.Description: MaterialID is a generic parameter defined on all material locations and will report the identical value as SubstID on the SubstrateLocation

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the SubstrateLocation state machine. This value matches the SubstLocState with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The SubstLocState provides the current substrate location state enumerated value and SubstrateLocationCurrState provides the Substrate Location state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence

Attributes.Description: 80 characters maximum; Host defined identifier of the ControlJob. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob ObjID attribute and the CtrlJobID DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Holds the identifiers of any ProcessJobs in the active state. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob CurrentPRJob attribute and the CurrentPRJob DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

80 characters maximum; Identifier for the data collection plan to be used during the execution of the ControlJob. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob DataCollectionPlan attribute and the DataCollectionPlan DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

A list of carrierID for material that will be used by the ControlJob. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob CarrierInputSpec attribute and the CarrierInputSpec DV is unnecessary because EDA allows attributes in reports

AssociatedParameter.Description: The MtrlOutSpec defines the destination locations for the carriers and slots provided in the CarrierInputSpec

Attributes.Description: Maps material from source to destination after processing. In slot integrity mode the list shall be empty. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob MtrlOutSpec attribute and the MtrlOutSpec DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The MtrlOutSpec defines the destination locations for the carriers and slots provided in the CarrierInputSpec

Attributes.Description: List structure which maps locations or Carriers where processed material will be placed based on material status. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob MtrlOutByStatus attribute and the MtrlOutByStatus DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Identifier of a list of events on which the ControlJob shall Pause. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob PauseEvent attribute and the PauseEvent DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PauseEvent parameter reports the GEM300 event identifiers (CEIDs) and EDAPauseEvent reports the EDA source and event identifiers that will pause the ControlJob

Attributes.Description: A list of all ProcessJobs managed by the ControlJob and their associated status. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob PRJobStatusList attribute and the PRJobStatusList DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

A list of structures that defines the ProcessJobs and rules for running each that will be run within this ControlJob. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob ProcessingCtrlSpec attribute and the ProcessingCtrlSpec DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

Define the method for the order in which ProcessJobs are initiated. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob ProcessOrderMgmt attribute and the ProcessOrderMgmt DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

A logical flag that determines if the ControlJob can start automatically (true) or must be started by the user (false). This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob StartMethod attribute and the StartMethod DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)
Current state of the ControlJob. This parameter merges the E94 ControlJob CJJobState attribute and the State DV (since EDA allows attributes in reports)

AssociatedParameter.Description: The State provides the current ControlJob state enumerated value and ControlJobCurrState provides the ControlJob state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where State reports the ControlJob state prior to destruction and ControlJobCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the current state of the ControlJob state machine. This value matches the State with the exception of NoState

AssociatedParameter.Description: The State provides the current ControlJob state enumerated value and ControlJobCurrState provides the ControlJob state identifier for the state machine current state. The values for these parameters have a one-to-one correspondence except when the object is destroyed where State reports the ControlJob state prior to destruction and ControlJobCurrState reports NoState

EventData.Description: 128 characters maximum; State Id of the previous state of the ControlJob state machine

List of EDA event identifiers that cause the equipment to automatically transition to the Pausing/Paused states when one of the listed events is triggered. This parameter corresponds with the PauseEvent attribute except it provides the EDA names and sources for the events

AssociatedParameter.Description: The PauseEvent parameter reports the GEM300 event identifiers (CEIDs) and EDAPauseEvent reports the EDA source and event identifiers that will pause the ProcessJob
